intro: Terminalia fanshawei, commonly known as the Guangxi tallow tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern China. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and mountainous regions. Terminalia fanshawei is valued for its timber and has traditional medicinal uses in Chinese herbal medicine.
